thread.title: Man killed in Capitol Hill shootout identified
thread.title_full: Man killed in Capitol Hill shootout identified | The Seattle Times

author: Sami Edge
title: Man killed in Capitol Hill shootout identified
text:
The victim of a Sunday gunfight on Capitol Hill has been identified as 23-year-old Ramon Mitchell.
Shortly after 2 a.m. Sunday, Seattle police responded to a large disturbance at Pine Street and Melrose Avenue, where they found the wounded Mitchell in a parking lot. He was pronounced dead at Harborview Medical Center, a hospital spokeswoman said Sunday.
The King County Medical Examiner’s Office on Tuesday ruled Mitchell’s death a homicide, as a result of multiple gunshot wounds.
Police reported Sunday that numerous gun casings were found at the scene of the shooting, indicating there were multiple shooters. The investigation is ongoing.
Most Read Stories Chelan blazes: With no end in sight, thousands evacuate Percy Harvin doubles down on comments about his Seahawks tenure Reactions mixed to NYT story about Amazon’s work conditions Jeff Bezos says Amazon won’t tolerate ‘callous’ management practices Inside Amazon: wrestling big ideas in a bruising workplace According to the founder of the website Northwest Gangs , Mitchell was the son of Hoover Crips founder Ritchie “OG Ratt” Williams, 37, who was shot in the head during heightened gang tension in 2013.
A GoFundMe page has been established to help cover the cost of Ramon Mitchell’s funeral.
Sami Edge: 206-464-3195 or sedge@seattletimes.com . On Twitter @sami_edge
